019package org.jgrapes.io.util;
020
021import java.io.Writer;
022import java.nio.CharBuffer;
023import java.util.Map;
024import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
025import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
026import org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel;
027import org.jgrapes.io.events.Close;
028import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
029import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
030
031/**
032 * An {@link Writer} that is backed by {@link CharBuffer}s obtained from a
033 * queue. When a byte buffer is full, an {@link Output} event (default) is
034 * generated and a new buffer is fetched from the queue.
035 */
036public class CharBufferWriter extends Writer {
037
038    private IOSubchannel channel;
039    private EventPipeline eventPipeline;
040    private boolean sendInputEvents;
041    private ManagedBuffer<CharBuffer> buffer;
042    private boolean sendClose = true;
043    private boolean sendEor = true;
044    private boolean eorSent;
045    private boolean isClosed;
046    private Map<Object, Object> eventAssociations;
047
048    /**
049     * Creates a new instance that uses {@link Output} events to dispatch
050     * buffers on the given channel, using the given event pipeline.
051     * 
052     * @param channel
053     *            the channel to fire events on
054     * @param eventPipeline
055     *            the event pipeline used for firing events
056     */
057    public CharBufferWriter(IOSubchannel channel, EventPipeline eventPipeline) {
058        this.channel = channel;
059        this.eventPipeline = eventPipeline;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Creates a new instance that uses {@link Output} events to dispatch
064     * buffers on the given channel, using the channel's response pipeline.
065     * 
066     * @param channel the channel to fire events on
067     */
068    public CharBufferWriter(IOSubchannel channel) {
069        this(channel, channel.responsePipeline());
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Causes the data to be fired as {@link Input} events rather
074     * than the usual {@link Output} events. 
075     * 
076     * @return the stream for easy chaining
077     */
078    public CharBufferWriter sendInputEvents() {
079        sendInputEvents = true;
080        return this;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Suppresses sending of a close event when the stream is closed. 
085     * 
086     * @return the stream for easy chaining
087     */
088    public CharBufferWriter suppressClose() {
089        sendClose = false;
090        return this;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Suppresses setting the end of record flag when the stream is 
095     * flushed or closed.
096     * 
097     * @return the stream for easy chaining
098     * @see Output#isEndOfRecord()
099     */
100    public CharBufferWriter suppressEndOfRecord() {
101        sendEor = false;
102        return this;
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Configure associations that are applied to the generated
107     * Output events, see {@link Event#setAssociated}.
108     * 
109     * @param associations the associations to apply
110     * @return the pipeline for easy chaining
111     */
112    public CharBufferWriter
113            setEventAssociations(Map<Object, Object> associations) {
114        eventAssociations = associations;
115        return this;
116    }
117
118    private void ensureBufferAvailable() throws InterruptedException {
119        if (buffer != null) {
120            return;
121        }
122        buffer = channel.charBufferPool().acquire();
123    }
124
125    /*
126     * (non-Javadoc)
127     * 
128     * @see java.io.Writer#write(char[], int, int)
129     */
130    @Override
131    public void write(char[] data, int offset, int length) {
132        while (true) {
133            try {
134                ensureBufferAvailable();
135            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
136                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
137                return;
138            }
139            var buf = buffer.backingBuffer();
140            if (buf.remaining() > length) {
141                buf.put(data, offset, length);
142                break;
143            } else if (buffer.remaining() == length) {
144                buf.put(data, offset, length);
145                flush(false);
146                break;
147            } else {
148                int chunkSize = buffer.remaining();
149                buf.put(data, offset, chunkSize);
150                flush(false);
151                length -= chunkSize;
152                offset += chunkSize;
153            }
154        }
155    }
156
157    @Override
158    public void write(char[] cbuf) {
159        write(cbuf, 0, cbuf.length);
160    }
161
162    @Override
163    public void write(String str, int offset, int length) {
164        while (true) {
165            try {
166                ensureBufferAvailable();
167            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
168                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
169                return;
170            }
171            var buf = buffer.backingBuffer();
172            if (buf.remaining() >= length) {
173                str.getChars(offset, offset + length, buf.array(),
174                    buf.position());
175                buf.position(buf.position() + length);
176                if (buf.remaining() == 0) {
177                    flush(false);
178                }
179                break;
180            }
181            int chunkSize = buffer.remaining();
182            str.getChars(offset, offset + chunkSize, buf.array(),
183                buf.position());
184            buf.position(buf.position() + chunkSize);
185            flush(false);
186            length -= chunkSize;
187            offset += chunkSize;
188        }
189    }
190
191    @Override
192    public void write(String str) {
193        write(str, 0, str.length());
194    }
195
196    @Override
197    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
198    public void write(int ch) {
199        char[] buff = { (char) ch };
200        write(buff, 0, 1);
201    }
202
203    @Override
204    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
205    public Writer append(char ch) {
206        write(ch);
207        return this;
208    }
209
210    @Override
211    public Writer append(CharSequence csq) {
212        write(String.valueOf(csq));
213        return this;
214    }
215
216    @Override
217    public Writer append(CharSequence csq, int start, int end) {
218        if (csq == null) {
219            csq = "null";
220        }
221        return append(csq.subSequence(start, end));
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Creates and fires an {@link Output} event with the buffer being filled. 
226     * The end of record flag of the event is set according to the parameter.
227     * Frees any allocated buffer.
228     */
229    private void flush(boolean endOfRecord) {
230        if (buffer == null) {
231            if (!endOfRecord || eorSent) {
232                return;
233            }
234            try {
235                ensureBufferAvailable();
236            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
237                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
238                return;
239            }
240        }
241        if (buffer.position() == 0 && (!endOfRecord || eorSent)) {
242            // Nothing to flush
243            buffer.unlockBuffer();
244        } else {
245            if (sendInputEvents) {
246                eventPipeline.fire(
247                    associate(Input.fromSink(buffer, endOfRecord)), channel);
248            } else {
249                eventPipeline.fire(
250                    associate(Output.fromSink(buffer, endOfRecord)), channel);
251            }
252            eorSent = endOfRecord;
253        }
254        buffer = null;
255    }
256
257    /**
258     * Creates and fires a {@link Output} event with the buffer being filled
259     * if it contains any data.
260     * 
261     * By default, the {@link Output} event is created with the end of record
262     * flag set (see {@link Output#isEndOfRecord()}) in order to forward the 
263     * flush as event. This implies that an {@link Output} event with no data
264     * (but the end of record flag set) may be fired. This behavior can
265     * be disabled with {@link #suppressEndOfRecord()}.
266     */
267    @Override
268    public void flush() {
269        flush(sendEor);
270    }
271
272    /**
273     * Flushes any remaining data with the end of record flag set
274     * (unless {@link #suppressEndOfRecord()} has been called)
275     * and fires a {@link Close} event (unless {@link #suppressClose()}
276     * has been called).
277     */
278    @Override
279    public void close() {
280        if (isClosed) {
281            return;
282        }
283        flush(sendEor);
284        if (sendClose) {
285            eventPipeline.fire(associate(new Close()), channel);
286        }
287        isClosed = true;
288    }
289
290    private Event<?> associate(Event<?> event) {
291        if (eventAssociations != null) {
292            for (var entry : eventAssociations.entrySet()) {
293                event.setAssociated(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
294            }
295        }
296        return event;
297    }
298}
